::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, spdep, tmap, tidyverse, sfdep)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                 layer = "Hunan")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `Hunan' from data source 
  `C:\BlumeTechnologies\ISSS626\ISSS626\In-Class_Exercises\In-Class_Exersice05\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 88 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): County, City
dbl (27): avg_wage, deposite, FAI, Gov_Rev, Gov_Exp, GDP, GDPPC, GIO, Loan, ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- left_join(hunan,hunan2012) %>%
  select(1:4, 7, 15)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Joining with `by = join_by(County)`
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
equal <- tm_shape(hunan) +
  tm_fill("GDPPC",
          n = 5,
          style = "equal", palette = "Blues") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Equal interval classification")

quantile <- tm_shape(hunan) +
  tm_fill("GDPPC",
          n = 5,
          style = "quantile") +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Equal quantile classification")

tmap_arrange(equal, 
             quantile, 
             asp=1, 
             ncol=2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-Class_Exercise05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm_q = hunan %>%
  mutate(nb = st_contiguity(geometry),
         wt = st_weights(nb,
                         style = "W"),
         .before = 1)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
moranI = global_moran_test(wm_q$GDPPC,
                           wm_q$nb,
                           wm_q$wt)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
global_moran_perm(wm_q$GDPPC,
                  wm_q$nb,
                  wm_q$wt,
                  nsim = 99)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Monte-Carlo simulation of Moran I

data:  x 
weights: listw  
number of simulations + 1: 100 

statistic = 0.30075, observed rank = 100, p-value < 2.2e-16
alternative hypothesis: two.sided
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lisa = wm_q %>%
  mutate(local_moran = local_moran(
    GDPPC, nb , wt, nsim = 99),
    .before = 1) %>%
  unnest(local_moran)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
map1 = tm_shape(lisa)+
  tm_fill("ii")+
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_view(set.zoom.limits = c(6,8))+
  tm_layout(main.title = "local Moran's O pf GDPPC",
            main.title.size = 2)

map2 = tm_shape(lisa) +
  tm_fill("p_ii",
          breaks = c(0, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, 1),
            labels = c("0", "0.001", "0.01", "0.05", "1")
          )



tmap_arrange(map1, map2, ncol = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Variable(s) "ii" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: number of legend labels should be 4
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-Class_Exercise05_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
